Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Shells
Description: Eight cowry shells from the Red Sea. White with black veins, they are pierced at one of the extremities. This hole suggests that these shells were included as part of part of a necklace alternating with beads, along which they were actually found . These shells are catalogued as type 83 shells by A. Vila.
